section.title: Description
section.p: ROLLBACK rolls back the current transaction and causes all the updates made by the transaction to be discarded.

plentry.pd: Optional key words. They have no effect.

section.title: Notes
section.p: Use COMMIT to successfully end the current transaction.
Issuing ROLLBACK when not inside a transaction does no harm, but it will provoke a warning message.

section.title: Examples
section.p: To discard all changes made in the current transaction:

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: The SQL standard only specifies the two forms ROLLBACK and ROLLBACK WORK. Otherwise, this command is fully conforming.
